caption: A beautiful sunrise over Zion Canyon with red rock cliffs.
The winding trail through the forested canyon walls.
Sheer cliff faces bathed in golden light.
A narrow canyon with textured sandstone walls.
River reflecting the vibrant canyon colors.

This was from early on day one of backpacking. Our shuttle driver Tam gave us a short history lesson on the area (the rocks of Rockville) and a brief personal history. She's got serious beef with the Holiday Inn in La Verkin. Tam was very cool, hope to cross paths again. Anyway, this was while we were still near Lee's Pass Trailhead. Probably took us two hours to go a mile there were so many views around here.
Hiking trail winding through red rock formations.
Sunset casting warm tones over the canyon.
Panoramic view of the canyon from above.
Canyon path illuminated by early morning light.
